intro: Riedelia capillidens, commonly known as the slender hairroot plant, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its delicate, hair-like roots and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces showy, pink or red flowers that bloom in the spring.
